etymologies: mid 19th century. From proto- + -lithic, after Neolithic, Palaeolithic, etc

definitions: (now disused). Designating or relating to the period in the development of human culture during which simple stone tools begin to be used; designating or relating to the earliest part of the Stone Age.
Designating primitive stone implements with minimal shaping; designating or relating to the use of such implements.

notes.text: The term was originally applied by the American anthropologist W. J. McGee (1853–1912) to the implements formerly in use amongst the Seri Indians of eastern Mexico.

definitions: Of the nature of or relating to a protolith.
